title: Search Warrant Documents-KH/STL City Circuit Attorney's Office

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All search warrants, applications for search warrants, affidavits for search warrants, authorizations for search warrants, denials/cancellations of search warrants, and search warrant returns and receipts documents pertaining to Kevin Hawkins between the date of January 1, 2018 to the date of processing this request. Please provide the following points of record for each:

• Full Name of requester
• Reason(s) for search warrant (typically either hand-written, or checkboxes)
• Badge ID (or similar) of requester
• Police District/Unit of requester
• Name of approving supervisor/commander
• Name of Judge
• Receiving/Issuing Court Jurisdiction
• Requested location of search warrant
• Location of search warrant execution
• Type of search warrant
• Statements used to justify search warrant
• Time and date when search warrant was submitted for approval
• Time and date when search warrant was authorized
• Time and date when search warrant was executed
• Whether an arrest occurred
• If arrest, arrest ID (i.e. some cities/states use, "Incident Report")
• Whether anything was found
• Whether anything was seized
• License plate of vehicle (if relevant)
• Legal code of violation
• Description of violation
• Date of violation
• Whether other local, state or federal law enforcement organization(s) involved (i.e. MSHP, FBI, DHS, NSA)
• Name(s) of other local, state or federal law enforcement organization(s) involved
• ID information (i.e. name of task force, agent id, etc.) of representatives associated with each local, state or federal law enforcement organization(s) involved
• Whether search warrant was cancelled

I request that in conducting searches for releasable records, that you please disclose records even if they are currently available publicly through your agency portal, other sources outside of your agency, such as the Missouri Accountability Portal or the Missouri Courts website.

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.

If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by e-mail or by CD-ROM in necessary. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that show all initial and follow up incident reporting information pertaining to the incident that took place on Friday morning, March 1, 2024 on and near highway 270 northbound lanes, just before the highway 70 interchange between the hours of 8am and 10am. 

Copies of all records that show additional vehicle incidents that occurred on highway 270 between the interchanges of highways 44 and highway 70 that took place during the same hours. Please include documents that show details of vehicles make and model, that identify all local, state and federal law enforcement and safety agencies that collaborated in response to the incidents and that indicate whether there were any injuries or fatalities. 

I am also requesting all traffic and safety camera footage from the same section of highway along 270 between the interchanges of highway 44 and West Florissant Ave for the same timeframe of 8am to 10am 

 I request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically or by CD-ROM if necessary. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Crime data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Data on incidents/crimes reported from 1/1/2009 through 12/31/2020. I am part of a public health research team that is seeking this information for research aimed at reducing violence. We already received data from you on incidents/crimes reported from 1/1/2009 through 12/31/2020 and want to extend our analyses into 2021-2023.

Specifically we are looking for data on all incidents that fall under FBI UCR Part I and Part II [https://ucr.fbi.gov/crime-in-the-u.s/2011/crime-in-the-u.s.-2011/offense-definitions], including as many of the following fields as possible (based on the FBI UCR data elements shown at [https://www.fbi.gov/file-repository/ucr/ucr-2019-1-nibrs-technical-specification.pdf/view]):

Incident Number (UCR Data Element 2)
Incident Date & Time/Hour (UCR Data Element 3)
UCR Offense Code (UCR Data Element 6)
Offense Attempted/Completed (UCR Data Element 7)
Offender Suspected of Using (UCR Data Element 8)
Bias Motivation (UCR Data Element 8A)
Location Type (UCR Data Element 9)
Type Weapon/Force Involved (UCR Data Element 13)
Type Property Loss/Etc. (UCR Data Element 14)
Suspected Drug Type (UCR Data Element 20)
Type of Victim (UCR Data Element 25)
Type of Officer Activity/Circumstance (UCR Data Element 25A)
Officer Assignment Type (UCR Data Element 25B)
Officer- ORI Other Jurisdiction (UCR Data Element 25C)
Age of Victim (UCR Data Element 26)
Sex of Victim (UCR Data Element 27)
Race of Victim (UCR Data Element 28)
Ethnicity of Victim (UCR Data Element 29)
Resident Status of Victim (UCR Data Element 30)
Aggravated Assault/Homicide Circumstances (UCR Data Element 31)
Type Injury (UCR Data Element 33)
Age of Offender (UCR Data Element 37)
Sex of Offender (UCR Data Element 38)
Race of Offender (UCR Data Element 39)
Ethnicity of Offender (UCR Data Element 39A)
Arrest Date (UCR Data Element 42)
Type of Arrest (UCR Data Element 43)
UCR Arrest Offense Code (UCR Data Element 43)
Age of Arrestee (UCR Data Element 47)
Sex of Arrestee (UCR Data Element 48)
Race of Arrestee (UCR Data Element 49)
Ethnicity of Arrestee (UCR Data Element 50)
Resident Status of Arrestee (UCR Data Element 51)
Disposition of Arrestee Under 18 (UCR Data Element 52)

and

street level location data for each incident, such as a geocoded location, street address, census block and/or census block group

We are requesting this data in a machine-readable format such as Excel spreadsheets or .csv files.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christina Mair

title: Centers for Disease Control guidance changes - public comments

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Centers for Disease Control guidance changes - public comments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all records - logs, recordings, emails, etc... - related to communications from members of the public or other non-governmental entities with the following phone numbers:
404-639-7000
800-232-4636

...and the following contact form:
https://wwwn.cdc.gov/dcs/ContactUs/Form

....between the following dates in two time periods:
1: February 1, 2024 to the date of the conduct of the records search
2: August 1, 2022, to August 31, 2022

...specifically for records related to or otherwise also mentioning the changing of COVID-19 guidelines and recommendations.

Please include anything related to replying to the inquiries of members of the public or other non-government entities.

I hear that for 404-639-7000 people have had to press 8.
I also hear that for 800-232-4636 people have had to press 1, then 4, then 1

I obviously do not need the PII for members of the public that is related to those communications

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ALEXANDER RICCIO
